alert.note: Alert for Northeast Aroostook; Northern Penobscot; Northwest Aroostook; Southeast Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 15 at 12:38PM EST until January 16 at 12:00AM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EST TONIGHT... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WIND CHILL WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Blowing snow and very cold wind chills. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. Wind chills as low as 34 below zero. * WHERE...Northwest Aroostook, Northeast Aroostook, Northern Penobscot and Southeast Aroostook Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 5 PM EST this afternoon. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until midnight EST tonight. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility and cause localized hazardous travel. Power outages are possible. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: A Winter Weather Advisory for blowing snow means that visibilities will be limited due to strong winds blowing snow around. Use caution when traveling, especially in open areas. A Wind Chill Advisory means that cold air and the wind will combine to create low wind chills. Frostbite and hypothermia can occur if precautions are not taken. Make sure you wear a hat and gloves. The latest road conditions for Maine can be obtained by going to newengland511.org.

area.areaDesc: Northeast Aroostook; Northern Penobscot; Northwest Aroostook; Southeast Aroostook
